Johnson Kee

Mar 15

318. Should you revisit the past if you’re lost?

I think we’re lost because we revisit the past.

I think a big part of tiredness in adult life is down to going through the same cycles, over and over. Not just with your daily routine, but also with vicious cycles you’re trying to break out of.

You tell yourself that you won’t eat any more junk food at night, but when it’s late and you’ve got the munchies, your thoughts automatically turn to thoughts of potato-ey goodness. Or you tell yourself that you will love yourself for a while then someone comes into your life who makes you feel great, them makes you feel terrible a few months later.

It makes us feel lost, like we have no control over our lives. Ironically, we’re not lost at all. If we’re stuck in cycles, we’re going through familiar motions. We feel lost because we’re powerless.

The important thing to note though is that our powerlessness is just a mirage. Cycles are hard to break out of yes, but the first step is acknowledging that they’re there.

The second step is to do everything in your power to make it impossible to enter the cycle again. Do this right and the third step — rewriting your story — becomes that much easier.
